content.prompt: ​The function f{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is given by fx=log3x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. Which of the following could be the graph of y=f-1x{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 1.8 comma negative 5.5).
  • The curve increases to reach (negative 1 comma negative 1).
  • The curve increases to the origin, becoming nearly horizontal at that point.
  • The curve continues to increase to pass through (1 comma 1) and exit the window at (1.8 comma 5.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 5.5 comma 0.1).
  • The curve increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma 1).
  • The curve then continues to increase, passing through (1 comma 2) and (2 comma 4) before exiting the window at (2.3 comma 5.5).

​

The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at (negative 5.5 comma 0.1).
  • The curve increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma 1).
  • The curve then continues to increase, passing through (1 comma 3) before exiting the window at (1.6 comma 5.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 5 in increments of 1. All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve begins at the origin.
  • The curve decreases, with an increasingly steep slope to exit the window at (0.9 comma negative 5.5).
  • A second section of the curve enters the window at (1.1 comma 5.5).
  • The curve decreases to pass through (2 comma 1.6) and (3 comma 1) before exiting the window at (5.5 comma 0.7).

​

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
